awd_titl_txt: X-Pinch X-Ray Source for Microlithography                   (REU SUPPLEMENT)
awd_abstract_narration: The X-pinch x-ray source driven by a pulsed power                               generator may be capable of exposing a resist on a                              complete 4 cm by 4 cm wafer in a single submicrosecond                          pulse.  This source consists of a 2 fine aluminum                               (Al) wires stretched between the output electrodes of the                       power source so as to touch at a single point in the form                       of an X.  Typically 500 J of 1.6 keV (7.8 A) Al K-shell                         radiation was obtained from a < 0.5 mm region at the                            point of contact of the two wires when a 4 ns, 500 kA                           current pulse was passed through them.  Experiments will                        be carried out to determine the resolution and correct                          exposure conditions for this source on a resist, to                             minimize the power pulse required for a few hundred                             Joule yield, to try magnesium and carbon in order to                            obtain a longer wavelength source, and to improve the                           pulse-to-pulse reproducibility.
org_div_long_name: Division of Electrical, Communications and Cyber Systems

pgm_ref.pgm_ref_txt: REU SUPP-Res Exp for Ugrd Supp
